page.title: 19Houses in Marlow
page.content: {New Houses. {Eliot Drive,}thirty three to forty one are terraced houses, nine years old. They all have big parking spaces and the garages are not near. The windows are just plain glass with wooden frames. The brickwork is English Bond. There are no cellars or chimneys. The front gardens are bigger than the back gardens. The surroundings are Great Marlow School's field and other houses. {Old Houses In{Marlow}many of the old houses are in{Glade Road.}Some of these houses date back to 1454. There are many different kinds of brickwork such as Flemish Bond, English Bond and Stretcher Bonds. There are also different types of windows. These include sash windows and bay windows. Most of the houses are semi-detached.
